SEARCH
Package com.gmail.aydinov.sergey.simple_debugger_plugin.core

Class DebuggerContext

java.lang.Object
com.gmail.aydinov.sergey.simple_debugger_plugin.core.DebuggerContext
public class DebuggerContext extends Object
Singleton context holding the current state of the debugger. Provides thread-safe access and status management.

Author: Sergei Aidinov
Email: sergey.aydinov@gmail.com

    Class

    static enum 
    DebuggerContext.SimpleDebuggerStatus
    Represents the possible states of the debugger.

  • Method Details

    • context

      public static DebuggerContext context()
      Returns the singleton instance of DebuggerContext.
      Returns:
      the DebuggerContext instance

    • getStatus

      public DebuggerContext.SimpleDebuggerStatus getStatus()
      Returns the current status of the debugger.
      Returns:
      the current SimpleDebuggerStatus

    • setStatus

      public boolean setStatus(DebuggerContext.SimpleDebuggerStatus newStatus)
      Updates the debugger status in a thread-safe manner. Logs state transitions if the status actually changes.
      Parameters:
      newStatus - the new status to set

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns true if the debugger is in a running state.
      Returns:
      true if debugger is running or session is active/finished

    • isInTerminalState

      public boolean isInTerminalState()
      Returns whether the debugger is in a non-terminal state.

      This method returns true if the debugger has not yet reached an unchangeable (terminal) state such as DebuggerContext.SimpleDebuggerStatus.STOPPED or DebuggerContext.SimpleDebuggerStatus.WILL_NOT_START.

      Returns:
      true if the debugger can still change its state, false if it is already stopped or cannot be started

    • isSessionActive

      public boolean isSessionActive()
      Returns true if a debugger session is currently active.
      Returns:
      true if the debugger session has started
